author: jimmygchen
content:
Is this still the latest proposed blob schedule?
https://notes.ethereum.org/@jtraglia/fusaka_scheduling

I think it would be great if we could measure these in the next large devent using the BPO3 schedule (21/32) from above:
- data column gossip verification time for a column with max blobs count
- block attestable time at the max blob count
- data column reconstruction time at the max blob count, i.e. if the proposer fails to propagate one of the columns for a block with max blobs, is the network able to recover it in time?
- sync speed on a network that averages the target blob count

because the devnet surviving doesn't really mean we are performant enough and it would give me more confidence if we have these numbers. 

Could we also try having some lighthouse nodes running with these flags?
- `--malicious-withhold-count 1`: this would simulate the scenario where proposer fails to publish to its peers (e.g. no peers in subnet)
- `--delay-data-column-publishing SECONDS` and `--delay-block-publishing SECONDS`: these may help identify issues where nodes aren't gossip verifying fast enough

(cc <@412614104222531604><@1351272205555863614> )
